title: Brigid Kosgei Would Have Led Marathon World in ’60
text:
The article on marathon running “Records Test Limits of Physiology” (Sports, Oct. 14) makes the point that Brigid Kosgei’s time of 2:14:4 broke Paula Radcliffe’s world record of 2:15:25 by a handsome margin of more than one minute. Historically, it is revealing that had Ms. Kosgei participated in the 1960 Rome Olympics marathon she would have beaten the men’s winner—Ethiopia’s Abebe Bikila—again by a margin of more than one minute and that her time would have been a world record.

Em. Prof. Scott A.G.M. Crawford

...
description: Had Ms. Kosgei participated in the 1960 Rome Olympics marathon, she would have beaten the men’s winner.
